title: The average weight of 8 people increases by 10 kg when a new person comes in place of one of them weighing 52 kg. What might be the weight of the new person? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let x be the average wt.of 8 people. Total sum = 8x kg. When a new member of wt y kg joins in place of one old member of 52 kg. Sum = 8x-52 + y kg. New average = (8x-52+y)/8= x+10 8x+80 = 8x-52+y y = 132 kg.

Let the average weight of 8 people be x kg Total weight if 8 people will be 8 x one person weighing 52 kg leaves Then weight of 7 people will be 8X - 52….(1) A new person joins and average weight increases by10 kg. So average weight of 8 people including one new one will be x+10 So total weight of 8 people 8(x+10) or 8x +80 ……(2) By substracting (1) from (2)we will get the weight of new person (8x +80) - ( 8x -52) or 8x + 80 -8x + 52 or 132 kg Ans 132 kgs
